question.text: In a first order reaction, the concentration of the reactant, decreases from <math><mn>0.8</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi></math> to <math><mn>0.4</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi></math> in <math><mn>15</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">u</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>. The time taken for the concentration to change from <math><mn>0.1</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi></math> to <math><mn>0.025</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">M</mi></math> is -

options.text: <math><mn>30</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">u</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>

<math><mn>15</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">u</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>

<math><mn>7.5</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">u</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>

<math><mn>60</mn><mi mathvariant="normal"> </mi><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">i</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">u</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">e</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></math>

solution.text:
0.1M →t1/20.05M →t1/20.025M
for the I st  order reaction :- t 3/4 =2× t 1/2 =2×15=30 minute
successive half lives in first order reactions remain constant irrespective of initial concentration.
